meanings.sent1: After reaching the other side, she started recrossing the bridge.
meanings.sent2: He recrossed the street to get back to his car.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel kept recrossing the same branch, making everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Recrossing the finish line, she felt a sense of accomplishment.
meanings.sent5: Recrossing the river, the fisherman found his favorite fishing spot.

meanings.definition: The act of crossing back over something.
meanings.sent1: The recrossing of the road was necessary to retrieve the lost ball.
meanings.sent2: The recrossing of the border took longer than expected.
meanings.sent3: The recrossing of the cat over the fence was quite a sight.
meanings.sent4: Her recrossing of the stage left the audience in awe.
meanings.sent5: The recrossing of the mountain pass was treacherous in the snow.
